channel.title: CVE Feed for Progress Software -- all
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Progress Software -- all products

item.title: CVE-2024-1212|2024-02-21T20:45:42.781Z -- progress%20software -- loadmaster
item.description: Unauthenticated remote attackers can access the system through the LoadMaster management interface, enabling arbitrary system command execution.

item.title: CVE-2024-0832|2024-01-31T16:47:23.600Z -- progress%20software -- telerik%20reporting
item.description: In Telerik Reporting versions prior to 2024 R1, a privilege elevation vulnerability has been identified in the applications installer component. In an environment where an existing Telerik Reporting install is present, a lower privileged user has the ability to manipulate the installation package to elevate their privileges on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-0219|2024-01-31T16:47:14.050Z -- progress%20software -- telerik%20justdecompile
item.description: In Telerik JustDecompile versions prior to 2024 R1, a privilege elevation vulnerability has been identified in the applications installer component. In an environment where an existing Telerik JustDecompile install is present, a lower privileged user has the ability to manipulate the installation package to elevate their privileges on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-0833|2024-01-31T16:47:33.646Z -- progress%20software -- telerik%20test%20studio
item.description:
In Telerik Test Studio versions prior to
v2023.3.1330, a privilege elevation vulnerability has been identified in the applications installer component. In an environment where an existing Telerik Test Studio install is present, a lower privileged user has the ability to manipulate the installation package to elevate their privileges on the underlying operating system.

item.title: CVE-2024-4837|2024-06-06T19:53:12.640Z -- progress%20software -- telerik%20report%20server
item.description: In Progress Telerik Report Server, version 2024 Q1 (10.0.24.305) or earlier, on IIS, an unauthenticated attacker can gain access to Telerik Report Server restricted functionality via a trust boundary violation vulnerability.

item.title: CVE-2024-4357|2024-06-04T17:54:31.326Z -- progress%20software -- telerik%20report%20server
item.description: An information disclosure vulnerability exists in Progress Telerik Report Server, version 2024 Q1 (10.0.24.305) or earlier, allows low-privilege attacker to read systems file via XML External Entity Processing.

item.title: CVE-2024-2291|2024-06-04T17:30:49.129Z -- progress%20software -- moveit%20transfer
item.description: In Progress MOVEit Transfer versions released before 2022.0.11 (14.0.11), 2022.1.12 (14.1.12), 2023.0.9 (15.0.9), 2023.1.4 (15.1.4), a logging bypass vulnerability has been discovered. An authenticated user could manipulate a request to bypass the logging mechanism within the web application which results in user activity not being logged properly.

item.title: CVE-2024-2448|2024-03-22T13:32:43.657Z -- progress%20software -- loadmaster
item.description: An OS command injection vulnerability has been identified in LoadMaster. An authenticated UI user with any permission settings may be able to inject commands into a UI component using a shell command resulting in OS command injection.

item.title: CVE-2024-2389|2024-06-04T17:30:21.656Z -- progress%20software -- flowmon
item.description: In Flowmon versions prior to 11.1.14 and 12.3.5, an operating system command injection vulnerability has been identified. An unauthenticated user can gain entry to the system via the Flowmon management interface, allowing for the execution of arbitrary system commands.

item.title: CVE-2024-2449|2024-03-22T13:35:39.103Z -- progress%20software -- loadmaster
item.description: A cross-site request forgery vulnerability has been identified in LoadMaster. It is possible for a malicious actor, who has prior knowledge of the IP or hostname of a specific LoadMaster, to direct an authenticated LoadMaster administrator to a third-party site. In such a scenario, the CSRF payload hosted on the malicious site would execute HTTP transactions on behalf of the LoadMaster administrator.
